PriceAdjustmentSchedule.name: PriceAdjustmentSchedule
PriceAdjustmentSchedule.description: Represents a series of tiered discounts based on the number of items purchased.

AdjustmentMethod.description: The method for applying tiered pricing. Possible values are: Range—All items receive the discount of the highest tier the quantity falls in. Slab—Items receive the discount defined for the tier they fall in.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

Description.description: Text description of the price adjustment schedule.

EffectiveFrom.description: The date and time when the price adjustment schedule comes into effect.

EffectiveTo.description: The date and time when the price adjustment schedule remains effective.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the price adjustment schedule is active (true) or not (false). You can change this field’s value as often as necessary. Label is Active. Default value is False.

LastReferencedDate.description: Indicates whether the price adjustment schedule has been archived (true) or not (false). This field is read-only.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

Name.description: Required. The name of the price adjustment schedule. This field is read-only. Label is Price Adjustment Schedule Name.

OwnerId.description: The Salesforce ID of the sales representative who owns the price adjustment schedule.

Pricebook2Id.description: The price book associated with this price adjustment schedule record.

ScheduleType.description: The type of price adjustment schedule.
